thread.title: Apple mulls Australian bond issue to diversify its debt book
thread.title_full: Apple mulls Australian bond issue to diversify its debt book | Business News | Business and Finance News | | The Advertiser

author: Mitchell Neems
title: Apple mulls Australian bond issue to diversify its debt book
text:
TECHNOLOGY giant Apple might consider its first-ever Australian dollar-denominated bond offering following a series of calls to debt investors this week.
Apple has tapped Goldman Sachs International, Deutsche Bank and the Commonwealth Bank of Australia to arrange the calls.
"A potential inaugural AUD-denominated offering may follow, subject to market conditions," an email from Goldman Sachs read today.
The move is likely part of a broader push by the tech giant to diversify its debt book.
Any Australian dollar raising would follow similar moves using Japanese yen, Swiss francs, euros and Apple's central funding currency, US dollars.
Apple is currently rated AAa1 by Moody's and AA+ by Moodyâ€™s.
 Apple mulls Aussie bond issue
